</objects>

</hint>

<thinking>
The camera-perspective and object-perspective are inverse, causing the camera movement to appear reversed relative to the object's movement.
</thinking>

<answer-candidates>
0. Clockwise Rotation - The camera rotates clockwise from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
1. Counterclockwise Rotation - The camera rotates counterclockwise from source viewpoint to target viewpoint.
</answer-candidates>

<output-format>
Please output your reasoning in <rsn></rsn> XML tags first, and then output the index of the answer-candidate you choose in <ans></ans> XML tags. Do not output any other text.
</output-format>
answer:
<rsn>
The Red Fire Extinguisher and the Plant both appear to rotate counterclockwise from the source viewpoint to the target viewpoint. Since the camera-perspective and object-perspective are inverse, the camera must have rotated clockwise to cause this apparent counterclockwise rotation of the objects.
</rsn>
<ans>0</ans>
rsn: The Red Fire Extinguisher and the Plant both appear to rotate counterclockwise from the source viewpoint to the target viewpoint.
